author: Staff Reporter
text:
The uveitis department of Sankara Nethralaya will host ‘Inflammatio’, an international colloquium with experts from across the globe who will focus on the diagnosis and treatment for uveitis on March 18, 19 and 20. Addressing the media, Jyotirmay Biswas, director, uveitis department at the hospital, said it was the cause of 10 per cent of blindness in the world.

In 50 per cent of the cases, uveitis was not detected despite advancements in the field. It can occur due to infections such as tuberculosis, leprosy, dengue and AIDS or could be the result of auto immune disorders, when the body reacts against itself. If not treated at the right time, it will lead to loss of vision, he said.

Sudha K. Ganesh, Deputy Director of the uveitis department, said that the hospital sees around 1,500 patients every year for the same. “There is a lot more awareness now about uveitis and early diagnosis can do a lot more in helping treat it,” she said.

At the conference, uveitis and retina specialists will share their experiences in treating patients as well as have discussions on the latest technology and medical expertise available to treat it.

Areas such as paediatric uveitis will be covered.

Surgical video sessions have been scheduled too.
title: Meet to focus on diagnosis, treatment of eye diseases
